docs.lead_paragraph: With more children around the world surviving to adulthood, more people are now dying of noncommunicable diseases like cancer or heart disease.
docs.snippet: With more children around the world surviving to adulthood, more people are now dying of noncommunicable diseases like cancer or heart disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: More people worldwide are living into old age, but the gains in the United States were much smaller, according to a new study.

headline.seo: Life Expectancy Rises Around World, Study Finds
headline.main: Life Expectancy Rises Around the World, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Life Expectancy Rises Around World, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Report published in journal Lancet finds more people worldwide are living into old age and dying from diseases mostly associated with rich countries, like cancer and heart disease; also shows life expectancy gains in United States are much smaller, with American women only expected to live just under two more years of life.
docs.snippet: More people worldwide are living into old age, but the gains in the United States were much smaller, according to a new study.

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Warner was a trailblazer in a field that has come to be known as medical informatics, which involves the use of computers to help make medical decisions.

headline.seo: Homer R. Warner, a Pioneer of Using Computers in Patient Care, Dies at 90
headline.main: Homer R. Warner, a Pioneer of Using Computers in Patient Care, Dies at 90

docs.abstract: Homer R Warner, physiologist whose research helped introduce computer analysis to diagnosing illnesses, dies at age 90.
docs.snippet: Dr. Warner was a trailblazer in a field that has come to be known as medical informatics, which involves the use of computers to help make medical decisions.

headline.main: The Budding Health Care Costs of Climate Change

docs.abstract: A growing number of public health experts are recognizing the need to integrate information about a changing climate into their disaster preparedness and response planning.
docs.snippet: A growing number of public health experts are recognizing the need to integrate information about a changing climate into their disaster preparedness and response planning.
